intro: Eugenia unana, commonly known as the rough-shanked hibiscus, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with five petals and a prominent yellow stamen. Eugenia unana is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and showy blooms.
